content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 474.2 - Location of permit and sticker

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 502
(a) The statute requires that the permit be
carried at all times in the motor vehicle for which it was issued. In the case
of a drawn motor vehicle transporting automotive fuel, the permit must
accompany such vehicle. The permit must be produced for inspection upon the
demand of any authorized person. (b) The sticker must be securely and
conspicuously affixed to the motor vehicle for which it was issued as follows: (1)
on a truck, tractor, omnibus or other
self-propelled vehicle: on the body of the motor vehicle as near as practical
to the front registration plate; (2)
on a trailer or other nonself-propelled
vehicle that is used to transport automotive fuel: on the body of such motor
vehicle as near as practical to the rear registration plate. (c) In the event that the
structure of a motor vehicle is such that it is impossible or impractical to
affix the sticker as set forth in this section, with written authorization from
the Department of Taxation and Finance the sticker may be affixed to the left
side (driver's side) thereof. Such written authorization must accompany the
motor vehicle for which it is applicable. All stickers issued must always be
legible and be completely visible. Notes
